006
007package renderer.pipeline;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.framebuffer.*;
012
013import java.awt.Color;
014
015/**
016   Methods used by the pipeline stages to log information.
017*/
018public class PipelineLogger
019{
020   public static boolean debugScene = false;
021   public static boolean debugPosition = false;
022
023   /**
024      Use this logger's debug variables to determine
025      if the given message should be printed to stderr.
026
027      @param message  {@link String} to output to stderr
028   */
029   public static void logMessage(final String message)
030   {
031      if (debugScene || debugPosition)
032      {
033         System.err.println( message );
034      }
035   }
036
037
038   /**
039      This method prints a {@link String} representation of the given
040      {@link Model}'s {@link Vertex} list.
041
042      @param stage  name for the pipeline stage
043      @param model  the {@link Model} whose vertex list is to be printed
044   */
045   public static void logVertexList(final String stage, final Model model)
046   {
047      if (debugScene || debugPosition)
048      {
049         int i = 0;
050         for (final Vertex v : model.vertexList)
051         {
052            System.err.printf("%s: vIndex = %3d, %s\n", stage, i, v.toString());
053            ++i;
054         }
055      }
056   }
057
058
059   /**
060      This method prints a {@link String} representation of the given
061      {@link Model}'s {@link Color} list.
062
063      @param stage  name for the pipeline stage
064      @param model  the {@link Model} whose {@link Color} list is to be printed
065   */
066   public static void logColorList(final String stage, final Model model)
067   {
068      if (debugScene || debugPosition)
069      {
070         int i = 0;
071         for (final Color c : model.colorList)
072         {
073            System.err.printf("%s: cIndex = %3d, %s\n", stage, i, c.toString());
074            ++i;
075         }
076      }
077   }
078
079
080   /**
081      This method prints a {@link String} representation of the given
082      {@link Model}'s {@link Primitive} list.
083
084      @param stage  name for the pipeline stage
085      @param model  the {@link Model} whose primitive list is to be printed
086   */
087   public static void logPrimitiveList(final String stage, final Model model)
088   {
089      if (debugScene || debugPosition)
090      {
091         if ( model.primitiveList.isEmpty() )
092         {
093            System.err.printf("%s: empty primitive list\n", stage);
094         }
095         else
096         {
097            for (final Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
098            {
099               System.err.printf("%s: %s\n", stage, p.toString());
100            }
101         }
102      }
103   }
104
105
106   /**
107      This method prints a {@link String} representation of the given
108      {@link Primitive}.
109
110      @param stage  name for the pipeline stage
111      @param model  {@link Model} that the {@link Primitive} {@code ls} comes from
112      @param p      {@link Primitive} whose string representation is to be printed
113   */
114   public static void logPrimitive(final String stage,
115                                   final Model model,
116                                   final Primitive p)
117   {
118      if (debugScene || debugPosition)
119      {
120         System.err.printf("%s: %s\n", stage, p.toString());
121         for (final int vIndex : p.vIndexList)
122         {
123            final Vertex v = model.vertexList.get(vIndex);
124            System.err.printf("   vIndex = %3d, %s\n", vIndex, v.toString());
125         }
126         for (final int cIndex : p.cIndexList)
127         {
128            final Color c = model.colorList.get(cIndex);
129            System.err.printf("   cIndex  = %3d, %s\n", cIndex, c.toString());
130         }
131         if (p instanceof OrientablePrimitive)
132         {
133            for (final int cIndex : ((OrientablePrimitive)p).cIndexList2)
134            {
135               final Color c = model.colorList.get(cIndex);
136               System.err.printf("   cIndex2 = %3d, %s\n", cIndex, c.toString());
137            }
138         }
139         if (p instanceof Triangle && ((Triangle)p).textured)
140         {
141            for (final int tcIndex : ((Triangle)p).tcIndexList)
142            {
143               final TexCoord tc = model.texCoordList.get(tcIndex);
144               System.err.printf("   tcIndex = %3d, %s\n", tcIndex, tc.toString());
145            }
146         }
147      }
148   }
149
150
151   /**
152      This method prints a {@link String} representation of the given pixel
153      from a point that is being rasterized.
154
155      @param clippedMessage  {@link String} specifying if the pixel was clipped or not
156      @param x_pp   horizontal coordinate of the pixel in the pixel-plane
157      @param y_pp   vertical coordinate of the pixel in the pixel-plane
158      @param x_vp   horizontal coordinate of the pixel in the viewport
159      @param y_vp   vertical coordinate of the pixel in the viewport
160      @param r      red component of the pixel's {@link Color}
161      @param g      green component of the pixel's {@link Color}
162      @param b      blue component of the pixel's {@link Color}
163      @param vp     {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport} that the pixel is being placed in
164   */
165   public static void logPixel(final String clippedMessage,
166                               final double x_pp, final double y_pp,
167                               final int    x_vp, final int    y_vp,
168                               final double r, final double g, final double b,
169                               final FrameBuffer.Viewport vp)
170   {
171      if (debugScene || debugPosition)
172      {
173         final int wVP = vp.getWidthVP();
174         final int hVP = vp.getHeightVP();
175         final int xVP = vp.vp_ul_x;
176         final int yVP = vp.vp_ul_y;
177         final FrameBuffer fb = vp.getFrameBuffer();
178         final int wFB = fb.getWidthFB();
179         final int hFB = fb.getHeightFB();
180         System.err.printf(
181         "fb_[w=%d,h=%d] vp_[x=%4d, y=%4d, w=%d,h=%d]  (x_pp=%9.4f, y_pp=%9.4f)  (x_vp=%4d, y_vp=%4d)  r=%.4f g=%.4f b=%.4f",
182              wFB, hFB,      xVP,   yVP,   wVP, hVP,    x_pp,       y_pp,         x_vp,     y_vp,      r,     g,     b);
183         System.err.println(clippedMessage);
184
185      }
186   }
187
188
189   /**
190      This method prints a {@link String} representation of the given pixel
191      from a point that is being rasterized.
192
193      @param x_pp   horizontal coordinate of the pixel in the pixel-plane
194      @param y_pp   vertical coordinate of the pixel in the pixel-plane
195      @param x_vp   horizontal coordinate of the pixel in the viewport
196      @param y_vp   vertical coordinate of the pixel in the viewport
197      @param r      red component of the pixel's {@link Color}
198      @param g      green component of the pixel's {@link Color}
199      @param b      blue component of the pixel's {@link Color}
200      @param vp     {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport} that the pixel is being placed in
201   */
202   public static void logPixel(final double x_pp, final double y_pp,
203                               final int    x_vp, final int    y_vp,
204                               final double r, final double g, final double b,
205                               final FrameBuffer.Viewport vp)
206   {
207      // Call the previous version of logPixel() with an empty clippedMessage.
208      logPixel("", x_pp, y_pp, x_vp, y_vp, r, g, b, vp);
209   }
210
211
212   /**
213      This method prints a {@link String} representation of the given pixel
214      from a "horizontal" line that is being rasterized along the x-axis.
215
216      @param x_pp   horizontal coordinate of the pixel in the pixel-plane
217      @param y_pp   vertical coordinate of the pixel in the pixel-plane
218      @param x_vp   horizontal coordinate of the pixel in the {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport}
219      @param y_vp   vertical coordinate of the pixel in the {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport}
220      @param r      red component of the pixel's {@link Color}
221      @param g      green component of the pixel's {@link Color}
222      @param b      blue component of the pixel's {@link Color}
223      @param vp     {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport} that the pixel is being placed in
224   */
225   public static void logPixel(final int x_pp, final double y_pp,
226                               final int x_vp, final int    y_vp,
227                               final float r, final float g, final float b,
228                               final FrameBuffer.Viewport vp)
229   {
230      if (debugScene || debugPosition)
231      {
232         final int wVP = vp.getWidthVP();
233         final int hVP = vp.getHeightVP();
234         final int xVP = vp.vp_ul_x;
235         final int yVP = vp.vp_ul_y;
236         final FrameBuffer fb = vp.getFrameBuffer();
237         final int wFB = fb.getWidthFB();
238         final int hFB = fb.getHeightFB();
239         System.err.printf(
240         "fb_[w=%d,h=%d] vp_[x=%4d, y=%4d, w=%d,h=%d]  (x_pp=%4d, y_pp=%9.4f)  (x_vp=%4d, y_vp=%4d)  r=%.4f g=%.4f b=%.4f\n",
241              wFB, hFB,      xVP,   yVP,   wVP, hVP,    x_pp,     y_pp,         x_vp,     y_vp,      r,     g,     b);
242      }
243   }
244
245
246   /**
247      This method prints a {@link String} representation of the given pixel
248      from a "vertical" line that is being rasterized along the y-axis.
249
250      @param x_pp  horizontal coordinate of the pixel in the pixel-plane
251      @param y_pp  vertical coordinate of the pixel in the pixel-plane
252      @param x_vp  horizontal coordinate of the pixel in the {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport}
253      @param y_vp  vertical coordinate of the pixel in the {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport}
254      @param r   red component of the pixel's {@link Color}
255      @param g   green component of the pixel's {@link Color}
256      @param b   blue component of the pixel's {@link Color}
257      @param vp  {@link FrameBuffer.Viewport} that the pixel is being placed in
258   */
259   public static void logPixel(final double x_pp, final int y_pp,
260                               final int    x_vp, final int y_vp,
261                               final float r, final float g, final float b,
262                               final FrameBuffer.Viewport vp)
263   {
264      if (debugScene || debugPosition)
265      {
266         final int wVP = vp.getWidthVP();
267         final int hVP = vp.getHeightVP();
268         final int xVP = vp.vp_ul_x;
269         final int yVP = vp.vp_ul_y;
270         final FrameBuffer fb = vp.getFrameBuffer();
271         final int wFB = fb.getWidthFB();
272         final int hFB = fb.getHeightFB();
273         System.err.printf(
274         "fb_[w=%d,h=%d] vp_[x=%4d, y=%4d, w=%d,h=%d]  (x_pp=%9.4f, y_pp=%4d)  (x_vp=%4d, y_vp=%4d)  r=%.4f g=%.4f b=%.4f\n",
275              wFB, hFB,      xVP,   yVP,   wVP, hVP,    x_pp,       y_pp,       x_vp,     y_vp,      r,     g,     b);
276      }
277   }
278
279
280
281   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
282   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
283   private PipelineLogger() {
284      throw new AssertionError();
285   }
286}
